{"title": "Dormitory Love", "title_search": "dormitory love", "title_keyword": "dormitory love", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/dormitory-love/", "summary": "Romantic love comedy with six unique students from abroad

Spring has arrived, and love is in the air! Get ready to fall head over heels in love with the unique characters in the fully-voiced romantic visual novel game, "Dormitory Love."

Set in a student dormitory in Tokyo, this game follows the story of Jun Minase, who suddenly finds herself working as the dorm manager for a group of international students.

This game is an absolute must-have if you're interested in Japanese culture and love stories featuring charming and unforgettable characters.

With six love interests to choose from, there's someone for everyone. You can pursue the calm and serious German, Felix, or the selfish yet charming femboy Frenchman, Guillaume. Alternatively, you might fall for the star basketball player from the United States, Josh, or the enigmatic and mysterious Chinese student, Ling. Perhaps you'll be drawn to the gentle and carefree Russian photographer, Sasha, or the cynical British nerd, Sean.

As you guide Jun through the spring and summer seasons, you'll experience a variety of seasonal events, including cherry blossom viewing, a hot spring trip, visits to a water park, and a summer festival, all while building your own love story with one of the six unique characters. Along the way, you'll laugh, cry, and experience all the ups and downs of romance.

Features include the ability to customize the heroine's name, full voice acting, nearly 100 still images, and six rich love stories to experience. In addition, you'll gain detailed cultural insights into the Japanese way of life, making this game a truly immersive and unforgettable experience.", "genre": ["Visual Novel"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2023-04-28", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-932308-52.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-932308-52.jpg"], "video": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": [], "companies": ["HASE IM HAUS (Developer)", "PLiCy (Publisher)"], "platforms": ["Nintendo Switch"], "rating": "T", "official_site": null}

{"title": "The Paradixion: Son's Room", "title_search": "the paradixion sons room", "title_keyword": "the paradixion sons room", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/the-paradixion-sons-room/", "summary": "You wake up in a mysterious room that you've never seen before in your life. Explore the room, solve various puzzles, and uncover hidden stories to escape from this mysterious room.

{"title": "Sakura Bunny Girls", "title_search": "sakura bunny girls", "title_keyword": "sakura bunny girls", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/sakura-bunny-girls/", "summary": "Yori is a man on a mission. He's a professional security guard who'll take on any job if the price is right, and he's been involved in any number of top secret operations with high stakes and large financial rewards.

During one particular job, however, Yori receives quite the shock. While protecting an important, high classified briefcase whose contents are a mystery, Yori is accosted by a thief - and this thief is no ordinary criminal.

This thief is, instead, a beautiful young woman. She has a curvy body, a pretty face, long, silky hair... And she's wearing a bunny suit?!

That's pretty crazy - but what's even crazier is her ability to stop bullets with her bare hands, her superhuman speed, and her augmented strength.

Just who is this bunny girl, and what does she want with this briefcase? Yori is uncertain - but one thing is for sure. {"title": "Sue Shi Survival", "title_search": "sue shi survival", "title_keyword": "sue shi survival", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/sue-shi-survival/", "summary": "The ghosts of sea creatures you've slaughtered as a sushi chef are out for revenge. Survive the night by exterminating crowds of them for the second time in this survival roguelite!\n\nDescend floors 5 minutes at a time until you come face-to-face with the final boss. Brian, an eternal optimist, did not let this dissuade him from achieving his dreams. Believing no obstacle was too great, he kissed his mom goodbye and bounded off to be the inaugural member of his own golf league.

Squish, jump, roll, and spin your way to golfing glory by getting Brian to the flag on each hole. Improve your score through the use of strategic powerups and collect hats along the way that can totally change the game experience and give Brian some flare. 

Remember: "Don't SEE the ball. {"title": "Mordheim: City of the Damned - The Smuggler", "title_search": "mordheim city of the damned  the smuggler", "title_keyword": "mordheim city of the damned  the smuggler", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/mordheim-city-of-the-damned-the-smuggler/", "summary": "This Hired Sword is a new Hero-type unit that can be recruited to further customize your roster. The Smuggler is available for the Mercenaries and the Sisters of Sigmar Warbands.

The Empire's division benefits those who would sell contraband or avoid the many taxes imposed by barons and burghers. No commodity is more enticing to Smugglers than Mordheim's Wyrdstone. Smugglers must be skilled with swords and pistols, accustomed to fighting against many foes, and not averse to tricks and traps. Most of all, they must be charismatic, able to rally their comrades in their darkest hour.

The Smuggler has access to a unique new set of skills:
Active skills

* Black Powder Trap: Places a fake Search Bag that explodes and deals damage to approaching units.
* Liquid Courage: The unit takes a sip of a drink that increases Initiative and All Alone tests.
* White Powder Trap: Places a fake Search Bag that explodes and stuns approaching units.
* Hand Bomb: The unit throws a bomb that deals armor bypassing damage.
* Captain's Speech: Increases All Alone, Fear and Terror resistance of nearby allies.
* Impact Shot: A black powder shot that deals regular damage and bypasses some of the victim's armor absorption.
* Riposte Stance: The unit takes a Parry stance that also increases the chance to hit with Counter-Attacks.
* Captain's Order: Increases the damage of a single ally.

Passive skills

* Expert Fencer: While wielding a Sword or a Dagger, increases Melee resistance and Initiative.
* Tight Crew: When an ally is engaged in Melee with the same enemy, increases Dodge and Parry bypass against the target.
* Fine-Tuning: Increases Critical Chance of Black Powder Weapons.
* In and Out: After gathering a Wyrdstone, gain a buff which increases Movement and Initiative.
* Walk the Topsail: Gain bonus to Leap, Climb and Jump Down actions.
* Boarding Prowess: After a Leap or Jump down attack, increases the chance of dealing a Critical Hit.

{"title": "Grand Academy for Future Villains", "title_search": "grand academy for future villains", "title_keyword": "grand academy for future villains", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/grand-academy-for-future-villains/", "summary": "Congratulations! We are delighted to welcome you to the Grand Academy for Future Villains, the world's finest evil preparatory school, where unimaginable power begins with a world-class education!

The Grand Academy for Future Villains is a hilarious 200,000-word interactive novel by Katherine Nehring, where your choices control the story. It's entirely text-based, without graphics or sound effects, and fueled by the vast, unstoppable power of your imagination.

Looking for a career as an evil overlord? A mad scientist? A megavillain, a wicked witch, a final boss? You're not going to get there without hard work, dedication, and thorough education. In the space between worlds, between genres, beyond time and space itself, the Grand Academy for Future Villains trains the bad guys that every good story needs.

You, our hero -- or our villain, rather--will arrive at the Academy ready to learn, but you'll quickly discover that there's so much more to villain school than getting good grades. 

Our alumni have gone on to dominate worlds, conquer galaxies, break hearts, and succumb to the creeping darkness in their souls. The choices that you make at our school will determine whether you join their illustrious company. {"title": "Fantasy Fest!", "title_search": "fantasy fest", "title_keyword": "fantasy fest", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/fantasy-fest/", "summary": "FOUR WAYS TO INDULGE YOUR WILDEST FANTASIES!

DUNGEON HACK
Get ready for limitless danger-filled dungeon adventures! As an AD&D hero armed with weapons and magic, explore dungeons filled with the monsters of your nightmares. Hack and slash at these vile creatures, avoid treacherous traps and solve mind-bending puzzles. The randomized dungeon generator can create over four billion different dungeons -- that's a new monster hunt every time you play! 

FANTASY EMPIRES
Here's your chance to create alliances, defeat enemy kingdoms, and forge an empire! Under the guidance of a sophisticated computer Dungeon Master, who mediates all elements of game play, you'll interact with fantasy races, command dozens of troop types, send your heroes on quests, and construct a variety of buildings and fortifications. Before long, you'll become a master of all you survey!

UNLIMITED ADVENTURES 
Create your own AD&D fantasy epics with this powerful adventure design kit! Build maps and link them with teleporters, doorways and stairwells. Design dungeons and fill them with monsters from the massive character bank. Test your creations as you build and undo errors at the touch of a button. It's easy. It's fast. And the only limit to what you create is your imagination! 

STRONGHOLD
Build, expand and maintain a kingdom with this easy-to-use kingdom simulator. You'll deal with all the details of running your domain: Construction, farming, population, housing, taxes, troops, morale, changing seasonal conditions -- as well as a host of D&D monsters. Lead your kingdom in battle against computer -controlled adversaries -- defend them and become Emperor!", "genre": ["Compilation"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": null, "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/3/6-1-645960-13.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/3/6-1-645960-13.jpg"], "video": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": null, "crew": null, "countries": [], "companies": ["SSI (Publisher)", "Various (Developer)"], "platforms": ["PC"], "rating": null, "official_site": null}

{"title": "Frozen Shelter", "title_search": "frozen shelter", "title_keyword": "frozen shelter", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/frozen-shelter/", "summary": "Frozen Shelter is a first-person indie walking simulator game made in realistic 3D graphics. 

The events take place in an alternative modern Russia. The epidemic that killed half of the world's population forced people to hide in bunkers. Fear and misunderstanding of how to live on pressed on them more and more every day. One day the situation escalated so much that the only right decision was to escape and try to find food at the top.

The main character is a resident of one of the bunkers, an engineer who monitors the serviceability of equipment and eliminates its breakdowns. During the general escape, he was busy repairing one of the main elements of the bunker's life support. Now he has to leave the bunker using engineering ingenuity.

Imagine a laid-back, lo-fi exploration RPG where the player takes care of their new pal, who reveals bits and pieces of a grander and secret narrative as they help one another move forward - all this in tightly packaged, easy to play minigames!

Each night of the hunt delivers a unique, terrifying experience which requires strategic execution, a steady heartbeat, and a keen instinct for survival.

The village of Luna Nova is cursed, and the community's only hope of survival rests within the hands of the appointed Warden. Scavenge the cornfields for precious ambrosia in order to find salvation for you and your community. But of course, you are not the only one harvesting. Sacrifice health to gain helpful tools against the dreadful Devourer, cling onto the safety of the shadows, and pray this night is not your last.

Strategic decision making and adaptability are the key to survival. The draw of the cards may bring otherworldly abilities, good fortune, and modifiers that affect both the environment and the Devourer. Build a deck catered to your strengths and the challenges that await. Be wary as the moonlight hits the dense cornfields, as each night brings new horrors to face.

From the Devourer's unearthly sounds to Luna Nova's non-linear environment, become immersed in a bone-chilling atmosphere. Get lost in the darkness as you crawl through dense cornfields, unaware of what lies in the shadows ready to strike.", "genre": ["Survival"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": null, "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-927936-52.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-927936-52.jpg"], "video": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": [], "companies": ["Villainous Games Studio (Publisher)", "Villainous Games Studio (Developer)"], "platforms": ["PC"], "rating": null, "official_site": null}

{"title": "Digitanks", "title_search": "digitanks", "title_keyword": "digitanks", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/digitanks/", "summary": "Digitanks is a turn-based artillery strategy game developed by indie game studio Lunar Workshop. It modernizes the artillery genre with a strategy aspect in a 3D environment. Tactical thinking is also crucial as the player controls anything from a single unit to a large fleet of tanks. Play offline skirmishes or online battles against your friends, or enemies.

Story:

The Digizens of Digiville were happy and content.
They ate in tiny bits and bytes and always paid their rent.
They shared every Electronode and Data Wells were free,
But thats not very interesting, as youre about to see.

One day the shortest Digizen in all the Digiverse
He cried, U nubs OLOL i h4x j0ur m3g4hu|2tz!
The Digizens of Digiville just laughed and said, Thats great!
Youre way too short and youre just trying to overcompensate!

Our little man was not so pleased, retreating to his lair
He powered up his Trolling Rage Machine with utmost flair.
It sputtered up to life with a cacophony of clanks
And shortly then thereafter it began to spit out tanks.

The Digizens were sleeping when there came a sudden chill
And when they woke there was no longer any Digiville.
Its up to you now! You must act before it gets much worse,
And while youre there, why not conquer the whole damn Digiverse?", "genre": ["Artillery"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2010-11-02", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-198368-52.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-198368-52.jpg"], "video": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": [], "companies": ["Lunar Workshop (Developer)", "Lunar Workshop (Publisher)"], "platforms": ["PC"], "rating": null, "official_site": null}
